metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9878 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Pivotal Spring Framework before 3.2.18, 4.2.x before 4.2.9, and 4.3.x before 4.3.5. Paths provided to the ResourceServlet were not properly sanitized and as a result exposed to directory traversal attacks. It was discovered that Spring Framework incorrectly handled path inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to read arbitrary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.5-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.5-1').
